description: The observed behavior indicates that guests on a Hyper-V host running Windows Server 2019 may encounter backup issues when using Microsoft’s replication services in conjunction with Azure Site Recovery. This symptom reveals that simply deleting the RCT (Resilient Change Tracking) files can mitigate the problem for the affected virtual machines. Therefore, administrators are advised to monitor their Azure Site Recovery setups and consider this workaround if they experience similar disruptions.
